title: Publications
text:
MM Farnisa, BS Halpern, CR Fong. Nationwide exposure of United States cultural heritage to wildfire. In Review at Scientific Reports.
CR Fong, J Dudney, WD Hansen, MH Mockrin, MA Moritz, CJ Nolan, MP North, CM Tortorelli, RA King, CW Broderick, JM DeCesaro, EE Egg, MM Farnisa, BS Halpern. An index to assess wildfire resilience across the North American West. In Review at OneEarth.

title: About
text:
I am a Geospatial Data Analyst for the Western Wilfire Resilience Index at the National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis. This is a new project and I am excited to be a part of the initial team tasked with launching this
I am a passionate early career data enthusiast on a journey of exploration and discovery within the vast realm of data science. As I navigate this fascinating landscape, my dedication lies in honing my data analysis skills - from delving into statistical models to crafting compelling visualizations and learning new coding platforms, every step is a venture into the ever-evolving world of data science. What drives me is the genuine excitement about the endless possibilities that working with data can offer. I invite you to learn more about me on this growing website and join me as I work on some hobby coding projects here :)


education
MS in Natural Resources & Environmental Science | May 2020 - December 2022 | University of Nevada, Reno | Reno, NV
BS in Environmental Science | August 2014 - June 2017 | Amsterdam University College | Amsterdam, The Netherlands
Semester Abroad | June - December 2016 | University of Queensland | Brisbane, Australia



personal

title: Mona Farnisa
text:
Hello! My name is Mona. Welcome to my website!
I am a geospatial data scientist & analyst with interests in static and interactive visualizations, predictive and deterministic model development, spatial statistics, command line coding, and remotely sensed data. With over five years of experience coding, I have gained a wealth of knowledge and am excited to branch out my data skills working with new datasets and developing my coding skills.

My most recent job as a geospatial analyst on the Wildfire Resilience Index at the National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis was an exciting project that encompassed working with almost 100 geospatial data layers compiled across multiple social and ecological domains including infrastructure, health, vegetation, species, air, water, cultural heritage, and more.

I have a Master of Science in Natural Resource and Environmental Science from the University of Nevada, Reno where I was part of The Sustainable Horticulture Lab. My research was on plant environment interactions, crop yield analytics, and fertilization tracking. Read more about my graduate research on the Education tab.
I have a Bachelor of Science from Amsterdam University College in The Netherlands where I majored in Energy, Climate, and Sustainability.

I have spent a lot of time conducting fieldwork, working on farms and am passionate about sustainable agriculture. In my free time I like to bike, surf, and sew.
